page.title: 05THE WOOLPIT LORRY PARK
page.content: My Dad worked at the lorry park, Leggetts Transport. They made a new lorry park near the A45. There are more lorries than there used to be. My Dad thinks there are 50 lorries. I went in the lorry with my Dad and sometimes my Mum came too. We ate our sandwiches in the lorry. The lorries carry bricks and sugar and they go all over Britain. The drivers mostly live in Elmswell, Woolpit and Drinkstone. We saw 18 cars parked in the yard, 15 lorries and 10 trailers. At the park they have a mechanics' workshop. They have a breakdown service. At night they have guard dogs on patrol. There is a high fence all around the lorry park.
